intro: Cheilanthes glaberrima, commonly known as the glabrous rock fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen fronds that are typically covered in minute, non-glandular scales. This plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found growing on limestone or sandstone substrates. Cheilanthes glaberrima is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient and hardy species in its native habitat.
